xxl.core.spatial.cursors
Class Mappers

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.spatial.cursors.Mappers

public class Mappers
extends Object

This class provides several static methods returning suitable Mappers for the spatial context.

See Also:
Mapper

mapKPEToFloatPoint

public static Cursor<FloatPoint> mapKPEToFloatPoint(Iterator<? extends KPE> iterator,
                                                    boolean corner)
Return a mapper mapping an input iterator of KPEs containing a Rectangle as data item to Points. This is useful if one wants to extract Points from an existing data set of spatial data.

Parameters:
iterator - an input iterator containing KPEs
corner - boolean flag determining which corner should be returned by the mapping function
Returns:
a mapper mapping KPEs to FloatPoints

mapKPEToData

public static Cursor<Object> mapKPEToData(Iterator<? extends KPE> iterator)
Return a mapper extracting data objects from a given Iterator of KPEs. This is performed by calling the getData() method on each input object.

Parameters:
iterator - an input iterator containing KPEs
Returns:
a mapper mapping KPEs to the included data objects

pointToDoublePointRectangleMappingFunction

public static Function<Point,DoublePointRectangle> pointToDoublePointRectangleMappingFunction(double epsilon)
Returns a function converting a FloatPoint to a FloatPointRectangle where the point is the center of the rectangle 2*epsilon x 2*epsilon x ... x 2*epsilon. The input-Points are assumed to be inside the unit-cube.

Parameters:
epsilon - the epsilon distance (Note: rectangles of side length 2*epsilon are created)
Returns:
a function converting Points to FixedPointRectangles

Returns:

pointToKPEzCodeMappingFunction

public static Function<Point,KPEzCode> pointToKPEzCodeMappingFunction(float epsilon,
                                                                      int maxLevel)
Returns a Mapper mapping incoming FloatPoints to an Iterator of KPEzCodes containing a rectangle (of type Rectangle) as well as the corresponding z-code (of type BitSet).
This means, for each input FloatPoint this class computes
  1. a Rectangle with length epsilon in each dimension. The incoming FloatPoint is the center of the latter rectangle.
  2. the z-code of that rectangle
Both objects are contained in a specialized ConvertableTuple called KPEzCode which is returned by this Mapper.

Parameters:
iterator - an Iterator containing FloatPoints
epsilon - extension of the rectangles to be created in each dimension
maxLevel - the maximum level to be used for the z-code computation
Returns:
a mapper mapping FloatPoints to KPEzCodes

mapPointToKPEzCode

public static Cursor<KPEzCode> mapPointToKPEzCode(Iterator<? extends Point> iterator,
                                                  float epsilon,
                                                  int maxLevel)
Returns a Mapper mapping incoming FloatPoints to an Iterator of KPEzCodes containing a rectangle (of type Rectangle) as well as the corresponding z-code (of type BitSet).
This means, for each input FloatPoint this class computes
  1. a Rectangle with length epsilon in each dimension. The incoming FloatPoint is the center of the latter rectangle.
  2. the z-code of that rectangle
Both objects are contained in a specialized ConvertableTuple called KPEzCode which is returned by this Mapper.

Parameters:
iterator - an Iterator containing FloatPoints
epsilon - extension of the rectangles to be created in each dimension
maxLevel - the maximum level to be used for the z-code computation
Returns:
a mapper mapping FloatPoints to KPEzCodes

pointToFixedPointRectangleMappingFunction

public static Function<Point,FixedPointRectangle> pointToFixedPointRectangleMappingFunction(double epsilon)
Returns a function converting a Point to a FixedPointRectangle where the point is the center of the rectangle 2*epsilon x 2*epsilon x ... x 2*epsilon. The input-Points are assumed to be inside the unit-cube.

Parameters:
epsilon - the epsilon distance (Note: rectangles of side length 2*epsilon are created)
Returns:
a function converting Points to FixedPointRectangles

mapPointToFixedPointRectangle

public static Cursor<FixedPointRectangle> mapPointToFixedPointRectangle(Iterator<? extends Point> iterator,
                                                                        double epsilon)
Returns a Mapper mapping a Point to a FixedPointRectangle where the point is the center of the rectangle 2*epsilon x 2*epsilon x ... x 2*epsilon. The input-Points are assumed to be inside the unit-cube.

Parameters:
iterator - an Iterator containing Points
epsilon - the epsilon distance (Note: rectangles of side length 2*epsilon are created)
Returns:
a mapper mapping Points to FixedPointRectangles
See Also:
#getPointFixedPointRectangleMappingFunction(double)

mapPointToUnitCube

public static Cursor<FloatPoint> mapPointToUnitCube(Iterator<? extends Point> iterator,
                                                    Rectangle universe)
Returns a Mapper transforming a given Iterator of FloatPoints to the unit-cube [0;1)^dim assuming that all Points are inside the given universe-FloatPointRectangle and that the Points are of type FloatPoint. This is an important pre-processing step needed e.g. for hihg-dimensional data.

Parameters:
iterator - an Iterator containing FloatPoints
universe - the minimal bounding rectangle of the Points
Returns:
a mapper mapping FloatPoints to into the unit-cube

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Use-case:
  1. compute universe for a file containing FloatPoints
  2. map Points of input-iterator to new value
  3. write them to disk


Parameters:
args: - args[0] input file-name, args[1] dimensionality of the data, args[2] output file-name
